sen.j: 藤原 家長（ふじわら の いえなが、生没年未詳）は平安時代末期の廷臣。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Ienaga (year of birth and death unknown) was a retainer of Imperial Court in the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Ienaga (years of birth and death unknown) was a retainer of the Imperial Court in the late Heian period.

He was a child of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Ieyasu.
He was the son of Sangi (Councilor) FUJIWARA no Ieyasu.

sen.j: 兄弟に藤原家成（中納言、四条家祖）、藤原保成らがある。
sen.e: His brothers included FUJIWARA no Ienari (Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), founder of the Shijo family) and FUJIWARA no Yasunari.
His brothers included Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) FUJIWARA no Ienari (founder of the Shijo family) and FUJIWARA no Yasunari.

He was Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice).
He attained the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and the post of Gyobukyo (Minister of Justice).

sen.j: 美濃国、土佐国、備中国、能登国などの国司を歴任する。
sen.e: He successively served as Kokushi (provincial governor) of Mino, Tosa, Bicchu and Noto Provinces and so on.
He served as Kokushi (Governor) of several provinces including Mino, Tosa, Bicchu and Noto Provinces.
He served as Kokushi (provincial governor) of several provinces including Mino, Tosa, Bitchu and Noto Provinces.

sen.j: 実家の善勝寺流（六条家流）は四条流庖丁道を伝える家柄である。
sen.e: His family home, Zenshoji-ryu (the Zenshoji lineage) (Rokujo Family-ryu) has handed down Shijoryu Hochodo (Shijo school of kitchen knives users (chefs)).
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」「包丁人」＝「Hochonin (chef)」は、広辞苑の定義を参考に訳しました。
sen.e: His family, the Zenshoji line of the Rokujo family, has handed down Shijoryu Hochodo (the Shijo school of Japanese cuisine).
His family, the Zenshoji line of the Rokujo family, has handed down Shijoryu Hochodo (the Shijo school of Japanese cuisine).

sen.j: 家長も鳥羽天皇の御前の酒宴において包丁人を勤め、魚をさばいた際の逸話が『古事談』に見える。
sen.e: "Kojidan" (Talks of the Past) contains an anecdote about the head of the family when he served as a Hochonin (chef) at a feast in front of the Emperor Toba and cut and trimmed a fish.
"Kojidan" (Talks of the Past) contains an anecdote about the head of the family serving as a Hochonin (chef), cutting and trimming a fish at a feast in front of Emperor Toba.

sen.j: 藤原忠実・藤原頼長父子に近侍し、その外出の際にはしばしば前駆を勤めている。
sen.e: He served FUJIWARA no Tadazane and his son, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga and often rode in advance leading the way ｗhen they went out.
sen.cmt: 「前駆」＝「rode in advance leading the way」は、広辞苑、新和英大辞典を参考に訳しました。
sen.e: He served FUJIWARA no Tadazane and his son, FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, and often rode at the head ｗhen they went out.

sen.j: その関係からか保元元年（1156年）の保元の乱においては崇徳上皇方に参じたと言われ、『保元物語』においては乱の後に出家・降伏した公家の中にその名が見える。
sen.e: Due probably to that relationship, he is said to have participated in the side of the retired Emperor Sutoku in the Hogen Disturbance in 1156 and his name was found in "Hogen Monogatari" (The Tale of the Hogen War) among the Court nobles who became priests or surrendered after the Disturbance.
